intro: Diplospora fasciculiflora, commonly known as the clustered leaf spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. Diplospora fasciculiflora is known for its toxic latex, which can cause skin irritation.
